byline.original: From the London Daily News City Article this morning

docs.snippet: No surprise will be felt should a rise in the Bank rate of Discount take place to-day. The applications at the Bank yesterday were not, however, on as active a scale as is usually the case when there is an advance in the rate on the following day.
docs.lead_paragraph: No surprise will be felt should a rise in the Bank rate of Discount take place to-day. The applications at the Bank yesterday were not, however, on as active a scale as is usually the case when there is an advance in the rate on the following day.

headline.main: FROM FORT PICKENS.; ARRIVAL OF LIEUT. SLEMMER AND HIS COMMAND. THE UNITED STATES SHIP ST. LOUIS. FROM BALTIMORE. REPORTS FROM TRENTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States transport Philadelphia, Capt. KITTRIDGE, arrived here yesterday morning from Fort Pickens, via Tortugas and Key West, making the passage from the latter place in six days and twelve hours. The Philadelphia brought Lieut. SLEMMER and his command, with twelve women and children and twelve mechanics.

headline.main: OBSEQUIES OF COL. ELLSWORTH.; Arrival of the Remains--Services at the Astor House--The Body in State at the City Hall --Ten Thousand Citizens View It--Imposing Civic and Military Display. RESPECT TO COL. ELLSWORTH IN KENTUCKY. REPORTS FROM LEAVENWORTH. THE STATE MILITARY DEPARTMENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: The echoes of the dirges that attended the obsequies of Col. VOSBURGH had scarcely died away, ere the Metropolis was called upon to participate in funeral solemnities which were simultaneously deplored throughout the North--so general has been the national mourning at the death of Col. E.E. ELLSWORTH, of the Fire Zouaves.

headline.main: Brilliant Reception at the Residence of the Secretary of State.

docs.snippet: I had become utterly tired of inaction, and was about returning to New-York, when, on Thursday afternoon, Col. ELLSWORTH sent for me and expressed a wish that I should remain in camp, as his regiment had been placed under marching orders, and he was...

headline.main: THE DEATH OF COL. ELLSWORTH.; Full Particulars of the Assassination by an Eye Witness-- The Zouaves Swear that they will be Revenged-- Singular Coincidences.

docs.lead_paragraph: I had become utterly tired of inaction, and was about returning to New-York, when, on Thursday afternoon, Col. ELLSWORTH sent for me and expressed a wish that I should remain in camp, as his regiment had been placed under marching orders, and he was confident that the Government would pursue aggressive measures within a few hours.

headline.main: OBSEQUIES OF COL. ELLSWORTH.; PROGRAMME OF ARRANGEMENTS.
